humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest invasive ductal carcinoma tumor measures 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The T stage is not affected by the number of lymph nodes involved or the presence of metastasis, so the T stage remains T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma measures 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (T2: Tumor size 2.1 to 5.0 cm). Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
